questions: How do I deploy cross-target services?

answer.text:
## Production Deployment

### Service Declarations

```prolog
:- declare_service(transform/2, [
    port(8080),
    workers(4),
    healthcheck('/health')
]).
```

### Security Enforcement

```prolog
:- declare_connection(client, server, [
    encryption(tls),     % Required for remote
    auth(bearer_token)
]).
```

### Lifecycle Management

- Graceful shutdown (drain connections)
- Rolling restarts
- Health checks

### Monitoring

```prolog
:- monitoring([
    metrics(prometheus),
    logging(json),
    alerting(pagerduty)
]).
```

questions: How do I deploy to Kubernetes?

answer.text:
## Cloud & Enterprise Deployment

### Container Deployment

```prolog
generate_dockerfile(service/2, Options, Dockerfile).
generate_k8s_manifest(service/2, Options, YAML).
```

### Secrets Management

```prolog
:- secrets_backend(vault, [
    addr('https://vault.example.com'),
    path('secret/data/myapp')
]).

% Also supports: AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault, GCP Secret Manager
```

### Serverless Functions

```prolog
% Generate AWS Lambda handler
generate_lambda_handler(transform/2, Options, Handler).

% Generate Google Cloud Function
generate_gcf_handler(transform/2, Options, Handler).

% Generate Azure Function
generate_azure_function(transform/2, Options, Handler).
```

questions: What are real-world use cases for cross-target glue?
How do I build an ETL pipeline?
How do I build microservices with UnifyWeaver?

answer.text:
## Case Studies

### ETL Pipeline: Bash + AWK + Python + SQL

```
Bash (curl) → AWK (filter) → Python (pandas) → SQL (load)
```

### .NET Integration: C# + PowerShell + IronPython

```
PowerShell (orchestration)
     ↓ (in-process)
C# (business logic)
     ↓ (in-process)
IronPython (ML model)
```

### High-Performance: Go + Rust

```
Go (parallel parse) → Rust (SIMD transform) → Go (aggregate)
     8 goroutines          vectorized           merge results
```

### Microservices: Distributed HTTP

```
Go Service A ←──HTTP/JSON──→ Rust Service B
      ↓                            ↓
   Local DB                   Local Cache
```
